thread.title: Get free access to CapeNature reserves
thread.title_full: Get free access to CapeNature reserves

author: Megan Ellis
title: Get free access to CapeNature reserves
text:
Get free access to CapeNature reserves Article By: Megan Ellis Wed, 16 Sep 2015 5:20 PM Share Your Email Walker Bay Nature Reserve. Credit: Megan Ellis 
National Parks Week is almost over, but there's another week on its way which will give you more free access to beautiful places. 
This time it comes in the form of CapeNature Access Week, which will give visitors free access to all CapeNature reserves from September 21 to September 27. 
Access to activities like day hiking, white river rafting with your own canoe, mountain biking with your own bicycle and picnicking will also be free. 
No prior bookings will be taken. 
CapeNature reserves are spread across the Western Cape, with reserves located in the Karoo, Winelands, the Overberg, the Garden Route and the West Coast. 
The list of CapeNature reserves is quite lengthy, giving you more than enough places you can visit. You can see the list here . 
We can personally attest to the beauty of the Walker Bay Reserve. 
Other reserves you can visit include the Stony Point Nature Reserve, Grootvadersbosch Nature Reserve and Kogelberg Nature Reserve. 
CapeNature Access Week however does not waive accommodation, camping and multi-day hike fees. Related Articles
